turtlefx

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • turtlefx.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.util.Observable
    Turtle class for drawing on the screen

    Provides basic functionality for moving around the screen and drawing a line as you go.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle(World w, int x, int y, int direction)
      Create a new Turtle at the specified position and direction
      Turtle(World w, java.lang.String name, int x, int y, int direction)
      Create a new Turtle at the specified position and direction

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Fill in the shape that's currently being drawn with the Turtle

      Get the color of the pixel that's directly underneath the center of the circle

      Get the current heading of the Turtle in degrees

      Tells you the number of commands that have been given to this Turtle

      Tells you if the pen is currently down or not

      Move the Turtle backwards the specified distance relative to its current heading (drawing a line IF the pen is down)

      Move the Turtle forward the specified distance relative to its current heading (drawing a line IF the pen is down)

      Make the Turtle invisible
      void home()
      Move the Turtle to the center of the screen
      void penDown()
      Place the pen down which makes it draw wherever you move the Turtle
      void penUp()
      Lift the pen up: the Turtle will no longer draws lines on the screen

      Point the Turtle in a specific direction regardless of it current heading

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(World w,
              int x,
              int y,
              int direction)
        Create a new Turtle at the specified position and direction
        Parameters:
        x - x-position in pixels (from the left)
        y - y-position in pixels (from the top)
        direction - direction the turtle will initially point towards: 0 = East, 90 = North, etc.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(World w,
              java.lang.String name,
              int x,
              int y,
              int direction)
        Create a new Turtle at the specified position and direction
        Parameters:
        name - The display name for this Turtle
        x - x-position in pixels (from the left)
        y - y-position in pixels (from the top)
        direction - direction the turtle will initially point towards: 0 = East, 90 = North, etc.
